item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 1, 2025 at 8:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Happy New Year 2025 (530 points | 145 comments)
2. Static search trees: faster than binary search (300 points | 98 comments)
3. Arnis: Generate cities in Minecraft from OpenStreetMap (300 points | 51 comments)
4. An Unreasonable Amount of Time (69 points | 2 comments)
5. Large Concept Models: Language modeling in a sentence representation space (57 points | 10 comments)
6. I Reversed a Drone and Landed It with My PC (90 points | 19 comments)
7. The GTA III port for the Dreamcast has been released (325 points | 93 comments)
8. Déjà vu: Ghostly CVEs in my terminal title (95 points | 20 comments)
9. Nvidia bets on robotics to drive future growth (52 points | 32 comments)
10. The psychonaut field manual [pdf] (32 points | 7 comments)
11. Things we learned about LLMs in 2024 (627 points | 435 comments)
12. FBI: Largest homemade explosives cache in agency history found in Virginia (77 points | 63 comments)
13. Celestial Phenomena in 16th-Century Germany (7 points | 1 comment)
14. Building Game Prototypes with LÖVE (122 points | 46 comments)
15. Lucy: A concise language for describing Finite State Machines (20 points | discuss)
16. After a 24-second test of its engines, the New Glenn rocket is ready to fly (39 points | 53 comments)
17. India's food shortage filled American libraries (73 points | 34 comments)
18. Ask HN: Does the Framework laptop stand the test of time? (48 points | 27 comments)
19. Bench.co acquired after informing staff company was insolvent (45 points | 23 comments)
20. Deepseek: The quiet giant leading China’s AI race (371 points | 312 comments)
21. Systems ideas that sound good but almost never work (318 points | 194 comments)
22. Penrose Mazes (2020) (75 points | 10 comments)
23. Revisiting the NetBSD Build System (99 points | 13 comments)
24. Morris Chang and the Origins of TSMC (203 points | 54 comments)
25. 3D-printed neighborhood nears completion in Texas (29 points | 41 comments)
26. Just Words (YC W24) Is Hiring ( | hide)
27. Debugging memory corruption: who the hell writes "2" into my stack? (2016) (332 points | 144 comments)
28. Signalling chaos: Inside the Elizabeth line's two-day breakdown (20 points | 7 comments)
29. More telcos confirm Salt Typhoon breaches as White House weighs in (380 points | 312 comments)
30. I keep turning my Google Sheets into phone-friendly webapps (621 points | 208 comments)
